title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 6-2.7 - Injury and illness incident reporting
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 6-2.7 - Injury and illness incident reporting

State Regulations
A full report of any injury or illness incident occurring at a bathing beach shall be reported by the owner/operator to the permit-issuing official within 24 hours and recorded in a logbook. This shall include all incidents occurring at a bathing facility which: (a) result in death; (b) require resuscitation; (c) require referral to a hospital or other facility for medical attention; or
(d) is a bather illness associated with bathing water quality. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
6-2.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
